item.title: Excited for my colleague Angela Cobi√°n!
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Excited for my colleague Angela Cobi√°n!

Denver Public Library

With the Latino Awards, we are able to honor the works of Latino community members and the work they've done to improve their communities. Meet the winner of th...e Lena L. Archuleta Community Service Award - Angela Cobi√°n!

Angela Cobi√°n is a first-generation Mexican-American and a first generation college graduate. Ms. Cobi√°n graduated from Colorado College in 2011. During this time she earned the Fred Sonderman Award in Political Science and membership in the Pi Gamma Mu Honors Society.

Following college, Ms. Cobi√°n returned to Denver to teach Literacy for English Language Acquisition-Spanish students in the second and third grade, she also earned a Masters in Curriculum and Instruction from the University of Colorado-Denver. In 2013, she was awarded a Fulbright scholarship to consult with Ensena por Mexico on program development for student-led social change initiatives and to teach English at the National Pedagogical University in Mexico City.

Upon her return from Mexico, Cobi√°n was a Bilingual Community Organizer with Together Colorado, an affiliate of the PICO National Network. She co-led school and congregation-based organizations alongside parents and parishioners addressing immigration and education issues. She continues her work in collective action today as the Director of National Organizing and Development with Leadership for Educational Equity (LEE). The Denver Foundation awarded her the Swanee Hunt Emerging Leader Award in 2017 in recognition of her community work.

Ms. Cobi√°n currently represents District 2 on the Denver Public Schools (DPS) Board of Education. She also serves as Treasurer and Chairperson of the Finance and Audit Committee, and co-led the 2020-21 budget process and COVID-19 response with the DPS Chief Financial Officer.

Ms. Cobi√°n is not only a voice for her constituents, she has used her organizing skills to activate her constituents to be involved in education and elevated their voices in the Denver Public Schools decision-making process.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: BREAKING: The Denver School Board has voted to recognize the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

BREAKING:

The Denver School Board has voted to recognize the Denver School Leaders Association as the official union for school leaders in Denver Public Schools.

My YES vote tonight was for the Black women leaders in DPS that for too long have been underpaid and overlooked.

item.title: ‚ÄúAs an African American school board member being in the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

‚ÄúAs an African American school board member being in the Denver Public Schools, I didn‚Äôt really even learn about my history as a Black person until my junior year of high school,‚Äù Anderson said. ‚ÄúWe have to be able to teach that our African American, Indigenous, Latinx folks were more than just minorities or more than just losing battles at times in history.‚Äù

Colorado‚Äôs largest school district is planning to revamp what it teaches to be more inclusive, equitable and culturally relevant to students of color.

denverpost.com

Denver Public Schools to revamp classes with more Black, Indigenous and Latino history

Colorado‚Äôs largest school district is planning to revamp what it teaches to be more inclusive, equitable and culturally relevant to students of color.Colorado‚Äôs largest school district is planning to revamp what it teaches to be more inclusive, equitable and culturally relevant to students of color.

item.title: Today I began working back in the DPS building. I walked to my...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today I began working back in the DPS building.

I walked to my mailbox and someone mailed this letter to my office. I am disgusted ... furthermore I am grateful for our Safety and Security teams at Denver Public Schools immediately responding to this and opening up an investigation.

Regardless of political differences, THIS IS NOT OKAY.

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways ‚Äî I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences ‚Äî I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
